definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing

sentences.english: Embracing warm blood, I sing of youth without regret. Look upon the horizon and know not when my ally would return.
sentences.chinese: 满腔热血唱出青春无悔，望穿天涯不知战友何时回。

sentences.english: Passion alone cannot win the revolution; Passion just makes martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 光靠满腔热血，不会使革命成，只能制造烈士。
我是乔热血沸腾的愤怒。

sentences.english: In his veins dances the blood of hero.
sentences.chinese: 他的血管里沸腾着英雄的热血。

sentences.english: They love freedom and pledge their lives for their love.
sentences.chinese: 他们热爱自由，愿为他们的所爱抛头颅洒热血。

sentences.english: The news of Beijing successfully applied for Olympik Games mads us very excited.
sentences.chinese: 北京申请奥成功的消息令我们热血沸腾。

sentences.english: Would harrow up thy soul, freeze thy young blood.
sentences.chinese: 就会直穿你灵府，冻结你热血。

sentences.english: With youth and blood, courage and wisdom to complete the arduous task.
sentences.chinese: 用青春和热血，胆魄与智慧完成了艰巨任务。

sentences.english: But business is good because it attracts hot-blooded males.
sentences.chinese: 生意之所以好是因为这吸引来了热血男士。

sentences.english: A cavity blood, nowhere to flow, an upsurge of emotion, such as surge.
sentences.chinese: 一腔热血，无处可流，心潮澎湃如波涌。

sentences.english: She invoked a friendly frost to strike her blood.
sentences.chinese: 她用一种宜人的寒霜冻结她的热血。

sentences.english: I felt alive. I felt full of blood.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得生机勃勃，热血沸腾。

sentences.english: By this time, my fighting blood was boiling.
sentences.chinese: 到这时候，我的热血沸腾起来。

sentences.english: Instantly the blood crept warmly over her body. Her nervous tension relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 热血立刻悄悄地流遍全身，使她的紧张心情松弛下来。

sentences.english: A research indicates that dinosaurs were warm -blooded animals .
sentences.chinese: 一项研究表明恐龙是热血动物。

sentences.english: Overcrowded with 100,000 cold-blooded bees, the hive had become a warm-blooded organism.
sentences.chinese: 挤了十万只冷血蜜蜂的蜂巢已经变成热血的生物。

definition: to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
